===Origins===
The '''Snowhawk Tribe''' was a [[Cimmeria]]n tribe whose foundation<!-- "in the far northwest" (possibly a lie from Conan, to locate his people in an unknown part of Cimmeria --> remains unknown, though it was unknown to the [[Cimmerians]] of [[Bafomai (Earth-616)|King Bafomai]]'s [[King's Elite Guard (Earth-616)|Elite Guard]], in [[Python (Acheron)|Python]], just before the [[Fall of Acheron]], circa 13,000 BC.{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #230|; Shall Python Fall?}}<!--

===Legacy===
The legacy of the Snowhawk tribe went on through Conan and his offspring, though they suffered tragedies as wemm: of his viable children, [[Conobar (Earth-616)|Conobar]] (the rapidly-aging son he had with [[Ursla (Earth-616)|Ursla]], a priestess of the wild) was slain in combat by his father,{{r|Conan the Barbarian #145}} [[Râ Morgana (Earth-616)|Râ Morgana]] (daughter he had, though didn't knew about, with a [[All-Mother (Midgard Vanir Priesthood) (Earth-616)|high priestess]]) was raised as the holy child of their priesthood, before leaving with her lover,{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #29|; Child of Sorcery}} [[Aryal (Earth-616|Aryal]] (whom was presumed to be his daughter with [[Tanya the Fox (Earth-616)|Tanya the Fox]]) was fated to die.{{r|Savage Sword of Conan #77|; Through a Glass Darkly}}

Finally, Conan became king of [[Aquilonia]], and married [[Zenobia (Earth-616)|Zenobia]], with whom he had two sons, [[Conn (Earth-616)|Conan ("Conn")]] and [[Taurus, Son of Conan (Earth-616)|Taurus]], and a daughter, [[Radegund (Earth-616)|Radegund]].{{r|Handbook of the Conan Universe #1|; Conan's entry}} Zenobia died during the bearing of their fourth childn{{r|Conan Saga #95|; The Conan Comics Chronology - Chapter Seventeen: The Agony and the Empire, IV. The Years Between}} a daughter. Conan eventually abdicated from his thone, and put his legacy in the care of his son Conn, Conan II of Aquilonia.{{r|Handbook of the Conan Universe #1|; Conan's entry}}<!-- [[Kang Sho (Earth-616)|Kang Sho]] (son with [[Kanmalag Lou-Dze (Earth-616)|Kang Lou-Dze]]): don't know this one yet -->
